thread.title: NSA Head: Loss of Access to Metadata Will Hurt Intelligence
thread.title_full: NSA Head: Loss of Access to Metadata Will Hurt Intelligence

title: NSA Head: Loss of Access to Metadata Will Hurt Intelligence
text:
28 NSA Head: Loss of Access to Metadata Will Hurt Intelligence 
Government Executive: On November 29, the NSA will formally end the practice of collecting bulk metadata â€“ records of calls between people but not the actual contents of those calls. Instead, the agency will rely on phone companies to keep the data for use by the NSA upon presentation of a court order. On that day, Americans will become less safe, argued Adm. Michael Rogers, the director of the NSA and U.S. Cyber Command, before the Senate Intelligence Committee.
